label: Upstash Redis (REST)
name: upstashRedis
description: Execute Redis commands via Upstash REST, including pipelining, transactions, monitor, and pub/sub.

options.label: Execute Command (Path)
options.name: execCommandPath
options.description: Execute a Redis command using /COMMAND/arg1/... path semantics.

options.label: Execute Command (Body Array)
options.name: execCommandBodyArray
options.description: Send the entire command as a JSON array in the request body.

options.label: Pipeline
options.name: pipeline
options.description: Batch multiple commands in one HTTP request via /pipeline.

options.label: Transaction (MULTI/EXEC)
options.name: multiExec
options.description: Atomically execute multiple commands via /multi-exec.

options.label: Publish
options.name: publish
options.description: Publish a message to a channel via /publish/{channel}/{message}.

options.label: Subscribe (SSE)
options.name: subscribe
options.description: Subscribe to a channel via /subscribe/{channel} (Server-Sent Events).

options.label: Monitor (SSE)
options.name: monitor
options.description: Stream Redis MONITOR output via /monitor (Server-Sent Events).

inputParameters.label: REST URL
inputParameters.name: rest_url
inputParameters.description: Your database REST URL (e.g., https://us1-xxx.upstash.io).

inputParameters.label: Use Query Token
inputParameters.name: use_query_token
inputParameters.description: If true, append ?_token=... to the URL; otherwise use Authorization header.

inputParameters.label: Token Override
inputParameters.name: token_override
inputParameters.description: Optional token to override the credential token (useful for read-only tokens).

inputParameters.label: HTTP Method
inputParameters.name: http_method
inputParameters.description: Allowed: HEAD, GET, POST, PUT. Defaults vary per action.

inputParameters.label: Command
inputParameters.name: command
inputParameters.description: Redis command name (e.g., GET, SET, HGET, ZADD).

inputParameters.label: Arguments
inputParameters.name: args
inputParameters.description: Array of arguments in Redis protocol order (e.g., ["foo", "bar", "EX", 100]).

inputParameters.label: Body Value
inputParameters.name: body_value
inputParameters.description: Optional raw body for POST to append as the last parameter (e.g., JSON or binary).

inputParameters.label: Extra Query Params (after body)
inputParameters.name: extra_query
inputParameters.description: Key-value map to represent trailing command flags after the body (e.g., {"EX":100}).

inputParameters.label: Command (JSON Array)
inputParameters.name: command_array
inputParameters.description: Entire Redis command as a JSON array, e.g., ["SET", "foo", "bar", "EX", 100].

inputParameters.label: Pipeline Commands
inputParameters.name: pipeline_commands
inputParameters.description: Two‑dimensional array of commands for /pipeline, e.g., [["SET","k","v"],["INCR","k"]].

inputParameters.label: Transaction Commands
inputParameters.name: multi_exec_commands
inputParameters.description: Two‑dimensional array of commands for /multi-exec (executed atomically).

inputParameters.label: Channel
inputParameters.name: channel
inputParameters.description: Channel name for publish/subscribe.

inputParameters.label: Message
inputParameters.name: message
inputParameters.description: Message to publish.

inputParameters.label: Accept SSE
inputParameters.name: accept_sse
inputParameters.description: Set Accept: text/event-stream header (required for /subscribe and /monitor).

inputParameters.label: Upstash-Encoding
inputParameters.name: upstash_encoding
inputParameters.description: Optional: set to "base64" to base64‑encode string fields in the response.

inputParameters.label: Upstash-Response-Format
inputParameters.name: upstash_response_format
inputParameters.description: Optional: set to "resp2" to receive raw RESP2 binary (not for /multi-exec; cannot combine with base64).

inputParameters.label: Raw Headers (Advanced)
inputParameters.name: extra_headers
inputParameters.description: Additional headers to merge into the request (advanced).

label: RapidAPI
name: rapidapi
description: Connect to any API hosted on RapidAPI. This node allows you to configure the base URL, required headers (including X-RapidAPI-Key and X-RapidAPI-Host), and any necessary path or query parameters to call an endpoint. Use this integration to dynamically call any API from RapidAPI's marketplace by providing the API-specific details.

inputParameters.label: RapidAPI Host
inputParameters.name: rapidApiHost
inputParameters.description: The host name of the API as provided by RapidAPI (value for the X-RapidAPI-Host header, e.g. 'exampleapi.p.rapidapi.com')

inputParameters.label: Base URL
inputParameters.name: baseUrl
inputParameters.description: Base URL of the API (including https:// and any base path if required, e.g. 'https://exampleapi.p.rapidapi.com/v1')

inputParameters.label: Endpoint Path
inputParameters.name: endpointPath
inputParameters.description: The specific endpoint path to call (e.g. '/users/{userId}/details'). Path parameters can be specified in curly braces and will be replaced using Path Parameters input. Do not include query string here.

inputParameters.label: Path Parameters (JSON)
inputParameters.name: pathParams
inputParameters.description: JSON object of path parameters to replace placeholders in the endpoint path. For example, if the endpoint path contains '/users/{userId}', provide an object like {"userId": "123"}. Leave blank if no path parameters.

inputParameters.label: Query Parameters (JSON)
inputParameters.name: queryParams
inputParameters.description: JSON object of query parameters to include in the request. For example: {"param1": "value1", "param2": "value2"}. Leave blank if no query parameters.

inputParameters.label: Request Body (JSON)
inputParameters.name: body
inputParameters.description: JSON object to send as the request body (for POST, PUT, PATCH methods). Leave blank if not applicable.

inputParameters.label: Content-Type
inputParameters.name: contentType
inputParameters.description: Content-Type of the request body (e.g. 'application/json'). If left blank and a body is provided, 'application/json' will be used by default.

options.name: getStatus
options.description: GET /status/:textId — check SMS delivery state.

options.name: getQuota
options.description: GET /quota/:key — check remaining credits for a key.

options.label: OTP: Verify Code
options.name: otpVerify
options.description: GET /otp/verify — verify a submitted code for a userid.

options.description: POST /sms-chart with comma-separated data for line/bar.

options.label: Chart MMS (Custom Chart.js)
options.name: chartCustom
options.description: POST /sms-chart with full Chart.js config.

options.label: Verify Reply Webhook Signature
options.name: verifyWebhookSignature
options.description: Compute & compare HMAC (X-textbelt-signature) for inbound reply webhooks.

credentials.label: API Key
credentials.name: api_key
credentials.description: Your Textbelt API key. Use "textbelt" for one free daily SMS; OTP test uses example_otp_key.

inputParameters.label: Base URL
inputParameters.name: base_url
inputParameters.description: Override only if instructed by Textbelt support. Defaults to https://textbelt.com

inputParameters.label: API Key Override
inputParameters.name: api_key_override
inputParameters.description: Optional: use this key instead of the saved credential for this call.

inputParameters.label: Phone
inputParameters.name: phone
inputParameters.description: US/CA: 10‑digit okay; otherwise E.164 recommended.

inputParameters.label: Message
inputParameters.name: message
inputParameters.description: Text content. Identify your organization and include opt‑out if recurring.

inputParameters.label: Sender (Compliance, optional)
inputParameters.name: sender
inputParameters.description: Business/organization name for compliance. Not visible in most countries.

inputParameters.label: Reply Webhook URL (US replies only)
inputParameters.name: replyWebhookUrl
inputParameters.description: HTTPS endpoint to receive replies. Not supported on free key.

inputParameters.label: Webhook Data (≤100 chars)
inputParameters.name: webhookData
inputParameters.description: Arbitrary short string; returned as `data` in reply webhook payload.

inputParameters.label: Use Test Mode (_test)
inputParameters.name: use_test_mode
inputParameters.description: Append “_test” to your API key to validate request without consuming quota.

inputParameters.label: Text ID
inputParameters.name: text_id
inputParameters.description: The `textId` returned by send or OTP generate.

inputParameters.label: Key for Quota Lookup
inputParameters.name: quota_key
inputParameters.description: If empty, the integration will use API Key Override or stored credential.

inputParameters.label: User ID
inputParameters.name: userid
inputParameters.description: Your unique user identifier for OTP flow.

inputParameters.label: OTP Message Template (optional)
inputParameters.name: otp_message
inputParameters.description: Custom message. Include $OTP placeholder. Defaults to “Your verification code is $OTP”.

inputParameters.label: OTP Lifetime (seconds)
inputParameters.name: otp_lifetime
inputParameters.description: Validity window for the OTP (default 180s).

inputParameters.label: OTP Length (digits)
inputParameters.name: otp_length
inputParameters.description: Number of digits to generate (default 6).

inputParameters.label: Use Example OTP Key
inputParameters.name: use_example_otp_key
inputParameters.description: Use `example_otp_key` for test requests (does not consume your quota).

inputParameters.label: OTP Entered by User

inputParameters.description: Code to verify for the given userid.

inputParameters.label: Chart.js Definition
inputParameters.name: chart_json
inputParameters.description: Full Chart.js config JSON (as string).

inputParameters.name: webhook_signature
inputParameters.description: Signature header from Textbelt reply webhook.

inputParameters.label: X-textbelt-timestamp
inputParameters.name: webhook_timestamp
inputParameters.description: Timestamp header (seconds) from webhook.

inputParameters.label: Raw Webhook JSON Payload
inputParameters.name: webhook_payload
inputParameters.description: Raw request body string to verify HMAC against.
